page.title: 14RE-OPENING OF RHINNS HALL
page.content: The re-opening was a major event to the residents of both Portnahaven and Port Wemyss.It is the traditional meeting place for community matters and social functions. The hall was re-opened on 17.5.85 after the completion of essential repairs and extensive renovations. The Rhinns Hall was formerly a church hall in Mosspark,Glasgow.It was brought to Portnahaven in sections and rebuilt in its present site by an active group of people from both villages in {1931}/{1932}. The Hall Committee are responsible for the instigation of the following improvements prior to the halls re-opening:window repairs,renovation of kitchen and toilet facilities,a new roof in 1981-82 and a new floor, toilets,barand porch in {1985}.
